emails.subject: What's up with Vue 3.0? Here's how to find out from Evan You
emails.body: The opening keynote of VueConf US this year was Evan You (the creator of Vue), giving his State of the Vuenion address. He walked us through the journey of getting Vue 3 from a prototype to a reality the past year. He also dove into Vue's overall growth in the community.

emails.subject: Learn by doing - Vue 3 Zero to Intermediate in 8 weeks
emails.body:
Building projects is one of the most effective ways to learn - and _the_ most effective way _remember_ what you've learned - but it can be frustrating.

This 8-week course takes the pain out of 'learning by doing'.

Each week we give you

* a project that will grow your skills without overwhelming you
* links to hand-picked resources, such as Vue Mastery videos, that share the knowledge you'll need for the project (no more useless rabbit holes)
* answers to any and all questions you have while working
* feedback on your completed code (so you're only learning good habits)

Our instructors are standing by to answer your questions.

Ready to learn?

emails.subject: #177: Updated Vue.js Roadmap; Vuex v4.0.0-alpha.1 has been released; Kia King Ishii join the core team; Nuxt v2.12 released; Videos from Vue.js Amsterdam 2020 are here!
emails.body:
First of all, lets congratulate Kia King Ishii on joining the Vue.js core team! ðŸŽ‰ He has been doing an incredible job building vuex-orm and will now focus on working on the next versions of Vuex.

Speaking of which â€“ Vuex v4.0.0-alpha.1 has just been released! This is the version of Vuex that will work with Vue 3.0 but keep the familiar API you know from the current version.

emails.subject: Must-read Vue.js articles of the week
emails.body:
Hello Team,

Hope you are doing well! I've compiled a list of must-read articles about Vue.js from this week. These articles cover a wide range of topics and provide valuable insights into the latest trends and developments in the Vue.js community.

Here are the top 6 articles that I highly recommend:

1. [5 Common Mistakes to Avoid When Using Vue.js](https://www.sitepoint.com/common-mistakes-vue-js/)
2. [Vue.js 3.0: What's New and What's Changed](https://dev.to/vuejs/vue-js-3-0-whats-new-and-whats-changed-2ljn)
3. [How to Build a CRUD Application with Vue.js and Firebase](https://auth0.com/blog/how-to-build-a-crud-application-with-vue-js-and-firebase/)
4. [Vue.js Animations: A Complete Guide](https://alligator.io/vuejs/vue-js-animations/)
5. [Vue.js Directives: A Beginner's Guide](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/vue-js-directives-a-beginners-guide)
6. [Vue.js and GraphQL: A Perfect Match](https://blog.apollographql.com/vue-js-and-graphql-a-perfect-match-b03c3dcf6d9a)

I hope you find these articles helpful and informative. If you have any questions or need further information, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Best regards,

Mohamed Fadl

emails.subject: Must-read articles on the latest technical topic
emails.body:
Hello Team,

Hope you are doing well! I've compiled a list of must-read articles about the latest technical topic. These articles cover a wide range of topics and provide valuable insights into the latest trends and developments in the field.

Here are the top 6 articles that I highly recommend:

1. [The Future of [Technical Topic]: Insights and Predictions](https://www.sitepoint.com/future-of-technical-topic/)
2. [Top 10 Trends in [Technical Topic] for 2023](https://dev.to/top-trends-in-technical-topic-for-2023-2ljn)
3. [How to Build Advanced Applications with [Technical Topic]](https://auth0.com/blog/how-to-build-advanced-applications-with-technical-topic/)
4. [The Ultimate Guide to [Technical Topic] Development](https://alligator.io/ultimate-guide-to-technical-topic-development/)
5. [[Technical Topic] for Beginners: A Step-by-Step Guide](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/technical-topic-for-beginners)
6. [The Power of [Technical Topic] and Machine Learning](https://blog.apollographql.com/power-of-technical-topic-and-machine-learning)

I hope you find these articles helpful and informative. If you have any questions or need further information, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Best regards,

Mohamed Fadl
